neighbors.name: Military Brothers Moving LLC
neighbors.claims: Military Brothers Moving LLC is a local moving services company founded in 2014 by two military veteran brothers, Kevin and Bryan Hoey[Military Brothers Moving (company website)】, and business records list Bryan P. Hoey, Kevin M. Hoey, and Jeffrey T. Hoey as the LLC’s members [Better Business Bureau](https://www.bbb.org/us/az/sierra-vista/profile/moving-companies/military-brothers-moving-llc-1286-20087490). The company is based in Sierra Vista, AZ and has operated in Cochise County for over a decade with no public record of involvement in land use disputes [MapQuest](https://www.mapquest.com/us/arizona/military-brothers-moving-llc-358420099).
neighbors.influence_justification: Small local business; limited political or land influence

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage managing member Bryan Hoey directly, highlighting the project’s local economic benefits; consider offering moving or support service contracts to build goodwill and ensure a neutral or positive stance

neighbors.name: Kendall Family Trust
neighbors.influence_justification: Private family land trust; not an active organization in civic affairs

approach_recommendations.engage: Work with the trust’s individual decision-makers (trustees or family members) directly; address their personal concerns one-on-one and emphasize how the development can maintain or enhance their property’s value

overview_summary: The neighboring entities consist of a small local business and a private family trust. Military Brothers Moving LLC is a veteran-owned moving company founded in 2014 by two brothers and based in Sierra Vista, Arizona [Military Brothers Moving (company website)](https://www.militarybrothersmoving.com). Kendall Family Trust is a long-time landholding trust involved in numerous property transactions since the 1990s, indicating a private estate managing family land holdings [RealtyHop](https://www.realtyhop.com/property-records/search/kendall-family-trust-the). Neither organization has a documented public stance on the proposed development, and their direct influence in the community appears limited.
